page.title: 02Macclesfield Forest Farming
page.content:
FARMING
The main farming activity is sheep farming, the predominant breed being Gritstone x Suffolk. There is one rare flock of Woodland Whiteface. They graze on rough pasture enclosed by dry stone walling. The sheep are dipped in the Summer and Autumn, wormed several times in the Summer and injected against several major disorders. Shearing takes place in the Summer and the wool is sold to the British Wool Board. There are also suckler cows and calves and a few Friesian dairy cattle. Many farmers find it difficult to make a viable living from the farms and have to find additional outside occupations despite government subsidies.
